perturbation.original_text:
Neither the Franchisor, its Predecessor nor any person listed under Item 2 or an affiliate offering franchises under Franchisor’s principal
trademark:


(A)
has an administrative, criminal or civil action pending against that person alleging: a felony; a violation of a franchise,
antitrust or securities law; fraud; embezzlement; fraudulent conversion; misappropriation of property; unfair or deceptive
practices; or comparable civil or misdemeanor allegations.
perturbation.changed_text:
Neither the Franchisor, its Predecessor nor any person listed under Item 2 or an affiliate offering franchises under Franchisor’s principal
trademark:


(A)
has an administrative, criminal or civil action pending against that person alleging: a felony; a violation of a franchise,
antitrust or securities law; fraud; embezzlement; fraudulent conversion; misappropriation of property; unfair or deceptive
practices; or comparable civil allegations.
perturbation.explanation: The modification removes 'misdemeanor allegations' creating a contradiction because it originally stated that actions pending could be either civil or misdemeanor but now it omits misdemeanor allegations. This could cause uncertainty as to whether an action with a misdemeanor allegation can be brought up.

perturbation.original_text:
Neither the Franchisor, its affiliate, its predecessor, officers, or general partner during the ten year period immediately before the date of
the disclosure document: (a) filed as debtor (or had filed against it) a petition to start an action under the U.S. Bankruptcy Code (or any
comparable foreign law); (b) obtained a discharge of its debts under the bankruptcy code; or (c) was a principal officer of a company or a general
partner in a partnership that either filed as a debtor (or had filed against it) a petition to start an action under the U.S. Bankruptcy Code or that
obtained a discharge of its debts under the U.S. Bankruptcy Code during or within one year after the officer or general partner of the Franchisor
held this position in the company or partnership.
perturbation.changed_text:
Neither the Franchisor, its affiliate, its predecessor, officers, or general partner during the ten year period immediately before the date of
the disclosure document: (a) filed as debtor (or had filed against it) a petition to start an action under the U.S. Bankruptcy Code (or any
comparable foreign law); (b) obtained a discharge of its debts under the bankruptcy code; or (c) was a principal officer of a company or a general
partner in a partnership that either filed as a debtor (or had filed against it) a petition to start an action under the U.S. Bankruptcy Code.
perturbation.explanation: The modification removes 'or that obtained a discharge of its debts under the U.S. Bankruptcy Code during or within one year after the officer or general partner of the Franchisor held this position in the company or partnership.' introducing a contradiction. The text now implies that only the filing of a bankruptcy petition is relevant, while the original also considered debt discharge within a year of the officer's role, causing inconsistency.

perturbation.original_text:
IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties hereto have duly executed, sealed and delivered this Addendum dated this ______ day of
______________, 2015.
perturbation.changed_text:
IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties hereto have duly executed and delivered this Addendum dated this ______ day of
______________, 2015.
perturbation.explanation: The modification removes the word 'sealed' from the execution clause creating an uncertainty. In some jurisdictions, a seal has legal significance. By removing it, the modified text contradicts the implied requirement (or expectation) of a sealed document, leading to ambiguity about the legal weight and enforceability of the addendum.
